critique: The executive order seems to want to convey joy and surprise that Mrs. Lulie Hunt Tumipseed may be appointed to a suitable position in the Treasury Department without regard to the requirements of the civil service rules. The order also wants to convey sadness that Mrs. Tumipseed is the widow of a commissioned medical officer of the Public Health Service who died in the service on April 25, 1930, at Spokane, Wash.The order does not want to convey anger, fear, or disgust.
